<rdf:RDF
    xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"
    xmlns:geo="http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/wgs84_pos#"
    xmlns:virtrdf="http://www.openlinksw.com/schemas/virtrdf#"
    xmlns:dbo="http://dbpedia.org/ontology/"
    xmlns:yago="http://dbpedia.org/class/yago/"
    xmlns:rdfs="http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#"
    xmlns:dbp="http://dbpedia.org/property/"
    xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#">
  <yago:Location100027167 rdf:about="http://dbpedia.org/resource/Cát_Bà_Island">
    <dbp:name xml:lang="en">Cát Bà Island</dbp:name>
    <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Cát Bà Island is the largest of the 367 islands spanning 260 km2 (100 sq mi) that comprise the Cat Ba Archipelago, which makes up the southeastern edge of Lan Ha Bay in Northern Vietnam. Cat Ba island has a surface area of 285 km2 (110 sq mi) and maintains the dramatic and rugged features of Ha Long Bay.</rdfs:comment>
    <geo:lat rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float"
    >20.799999237060546875</geo:lat>
    <dbo:country xml:lang="en">Vietnam</dbo:country>
    <dbo:abstract xml:lang="en">Cát Bà Island is the largest of the 367 islands spanning 260 km2 (100 sq mi) that comprise the Cat Ba Archipelago, which makes up the southeastern edge of Lan Ha Bay in Northern Vietnam. Cat Ba island has a surface area of 285 km2 (110 sq mi) and maintains the dramatic and rugged features of Ha Long Bay.</dbo:abstract>
    <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Cát Bà Island</rdfs:label>
    <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://dbpedia.org/ontology/WorldHeritageSite"/>
    <dbp:country xml:lang="en">Vietnam</dbp:country>
    <geo:long rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float"
    >106.999725341796875</geo:long>
    <geo:geometry rdf:datatype="http://www.openlinksw.com/schemas/virtrdf#Geometry"
    >POINT(106.9997253418 20.799999237061)</geo:geometry>
  </yago:Location100027167>
</rdf:RDF>
